access.notes: WordPress site with accordion sections. EHI export PDFs are in a collapsed 'Export Specifications' accordion. Content is in DOM source, curl-accessible.

export_format.description: HL7 v2.3 ORU^R01 messages containing lab results. Each message includes patient demographics (PID), visit info (PV1), order details (ORC/OBR), and observation results (OBX). Supports embedded PDF results via Base64 encoding in OBX-5. The container/packaging method for bulk export is not described in the documentation.

documentation.notes: Two separate PDFs, one for each product line (Enterprise and Harvest). Each documents the same 7 HL7 segments but with product-specific field mappings. Enterprise has ~222 field definitions across 15 pages; Harvest has ~160 across 13 pages.

clinical.evidence: Lab results are the core clinical content. OBX segment documents observation values, units, reference ranges, abnormal flags, LOINC codes, result status (preliminary/final/corrected). OBR documents lab orders, panels, specimen types, ordering providers, draw dates.

demographics.evidence: PID segment includes: patient ID, name, DOB, sex, race, ethnicity, address, phone, email, SSN, marital status, language, death indicator. PV1 includes encounter/visit details, patient class (inpatient/outpatient), admit/discharge dates.

secure_messages.evidence: Searched for message/inbox/communication/portal/secure/correspondence — not found. This is a lab system; patient messaging is not a core function.

billing_financial.evidence: OBR-55 documents 'Billing Status', OBR-16.x maps to 'Billing ID', OBR-45 documents ABN (Advance Beneficiary Notice) status codes (GA=signed, GZ=refused). PV1-20 maps to 'Financial Class host code'. However, no dedicated billing tables with charge amounts, CPT codes, or payment information.

insurance_coverage.evidence: No IN1 (Insurance) segment documented. No fields for payer, coverage, eligibility, or authorization found in either PDF.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: No appointment/scheduling data. OBR-27.4 has a 'Scheduled draw date/time' field for specimen collection scheduling, but no appointment management data.

documents_images.evidence: OBX supports embedded PDF documents via Base64 encoding (OBX-2='ED', OBX-5.1='pdf', OBX-5.2='Base64', OBX-5.3=encoded PDF content). Harvest spec also mentions 'Encoded PDF Document' for microbiology and AP reports.

audit_trails.evidence: No audit trail data in the export specifications. The certification page lists 170.315(d)(2) Auditable Events and 170.315(d)(3) Audit Reports as separate certified criteria, but audit data is not part of the results export.

lab_results.evidence: This is the primary and essentially only data domain. Complete lab results export via HL7 ORU^R01: test names, LOINC codes, result values (numeric and text), units, reference ranges, abnormal flags, result status, approving technician, run date/time.

orders.evidence: ORC (Common Order) and OBR (Observation Request) segments document lab orders: placer/filler order numbers, ordering provider, order date, priority, specimen source, collection volume, fasting status, panel codes.

specimen_info.evidence: OBR-14 (Specimen Received Date/Time), OBR-15 (Specimen Source/Sample Type), OBR-9 (Collection Volume), OBR-10 (Collector/Phlebotomist identification).

provider_info.evidence: Multiple provider roles documented: Ordering Provider (OBR-16), Attending Physician (PV1-7), Referring Physician (PV1-8), Approving Technician (OBX-16), Collector/Phlebotomist (OBR-10), CC providers (OBR-28).

issues: Documentation covers only lab results export (HL7 ORU^R01), not a comprehensive database dump of all system data
Export container/packaging method not described — unclear how bulk export is delivered (individual HL7 messages? batch file? ZIP?)
No insurance (IN1) segment included in export despite PV1 having Financial Class field
No audit trail data included in export despite system being certified for 170.315(d)(2) Auditable Events
Documentation titles say 'Results Export' not 'EHI Export' — scope may be narrower than full Designated Record Set
Both PDFs carry confidentiality notices restricting distribution to clients and their vendors — potentially inconsistent with ONC's public accessibility requirement
summary: Clinisys (formerly Orchard Software) provides two PDFs documenting their EHI export format for their lab information systems (Harvest and Enterprise). The export uses HL7 v2.3 ORU^R01 messages containing patient demographics, lab orders, and observation results with field-level detail including LOINC mapping. As a laboratory-only system, the scope is inherently narrower than a full EHR — covering lab results, orders, specimens, and patient demographics but lacking billing details, insurance, messaging, appointments, or audit trails. The documentation is well-structured with segment/field tables but is titled 'Results Export' rather than 'EHI Export', raising questions about whether it represents the complete Designated Record Set.
